content.description:
Blood On The Tracks traverses an interesting rail system on premium rock over a great landing.

Sit start with hands matched on a rail with some awkward feet. From there, match a left heel by your hands, move right on good edges, crank up and match hands on a sidepull (crux?), gain the jug, then dyno out right to a great edge (crux?), and finish straight up for the topout.

The topout of this problem is riddled with loose rocks, I was dropped from the top after grabbing a handful of unconsolidated rock. I recommend checking it out before pulling on.
content.protection: A few pads should do it, the landing is good.
content.location: This ascends the east face cubby of Hideout.

content.description:
Squat start on the obvious hold on the right side of the face. Make a big move to an awkward gaston, and match there. From there, get your feet up, and make one more big move, finding the good hold on the terrible top.

Be sure to be aware of your head as the boulder behind you is about 4-6 inches from the back of your head.
content.protection: Pads. The landing is great, but the boulder behind you makes falling sketchy.
content.location: This is on the right hand side of the boulder as you come into the inside of the cluster.

pathTokens: Gateway Vicinity aka The West End
Gateway to Mesa/Montrose County Line Boulders
